title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville launched 'Bye Bridget' merch after clapping back at an online critic.
The bakery's owner, Natalie Hug, created the merch following a complaint about donations to a food bank amid anti-ICE protests.
Proceeds from 'Bye Bridget' sales will also support charity, aligned with the bakery's tradition of charitable contributions.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jerry and Kit Boucher died on February 14 after falling through the ice at Bee's River in Eastham.
Their daughter, Katy Boucher, paid tribute to them, highlighting their community involvement and kindness.
Visitation and memorial services for the Bouchers will be held at St. Joan of Arc Church on February 27-28.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg, Massachusetts, are being investigated as arson, according to State Fire Marshal Jon Davine.
Two fires occurred on Feb. 14-15 at an apartment building on Blossom and Day streets; another on Feb. 18 on Myrtle Avenue.
The Feb. 18 fire injured one person and displaced seven; authorities consider potential links between the Blossom and Day street fires.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died from ALS at age 53 in February 2026.
Dane became an ALS awareness advocate after announcing his diagnosis in 2025 and received an advocate award.
A memoir by Dane, 'Book of Days: A Memoir in Moments,' is set to be published in late 2026.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Mass. State Police troopers charged with manslaughter in recruit's death are suspended with pay.
Enrique Delgado-Garcia died from blunt-force head injuries during a 2024 training exercise.
An independent review of MSP training practices by the International Association of Chiefs of Police is nearing completion.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police are alerting the public about a planned 'takeover' at South Shore Plaza on Friday at 7 p.m.
Police have created an operational plan and are coordinating with partners in response to the event's potential risk.
Past takeovers involved car meetups, street blockages, and incidents such as arson and fireworks, prompting state action.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins sees the Celtics as title contenders if Jayson Tatum returns from his Achilles injury.
The Celtics are currently second in the Eastern Conference with a 35-19 record despite offseason player losses.
Jaylen Brown's performance makes him a potential MVP, with top-five rankings in scoring and defensive stats.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN analyst suggests Patriots trade 2026 first, third, and sixth-round picks for AJ Brown and a 2026 second-round pick.
AJ Brown, 28, has had four straight 1,000-yard seasons and is under contract with the Eagles through 2029.
The Patriots would gain an elite receiver, having struggled with a lackluster receiver group in their Super Bowl run.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are considering Kyle Pitts as a top free-agent target to boost their pass-catching options.
Pitts had 88 receptions, 928 yards, and five touchdowns in 2025 with the Atlanta Falcons.
Pitts' projected contract is $17.5 million annually, potentially more affordable than other targets like Alec Pierce.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, from Provincetown, pleaded guilty to possession and distribution of child pornography in federal court.
Pagnoni was investigated after distributing thousands of files using the online storage platform MEGA, beginning in March 2023.
He faces up to 20 years in prison for each charge, with sentencing scheduled for May 12.
